data.title: Boba Tea
data.text: Boba tea is one of those things where you like it or you do not. Opening a bubble tea shop in Marietta was risky, but it was a success. It is not the most authentic boba I have had, but it is still tasty. It is more a coffee shop type place, and I love the new addition of space. It would be nice to have the milkshake/slushy drink as an option because that it how boba is traditionally served. I would stop in if you have never been! They have a great selection of teas and options of sweetness to your liking.

data.title: Freshly prepared perfection!
data.text: Tiny Bubbles is half gift shop, half Tea Bar. The Vietnamese style Bubble Teas are fantastic. Milk or no milk, you have a choice of tea and bubble flavors. They have some stand-by combos listed and of course you can customize, but I always have fun asking my barista for their recommendations. The macarons are delicious as well. Sometimes there is a line, but the service is relatively quick, so the back up is never long. I have a friend who discovered Bubble Tea in Vietnam who drives here once a month, because this is his favorite!

data.title: Addictive!!!!!
data.text: My daughter just dragged me into Tiny Bubbles on the Marietta Square for Bubble Tea. As a person who only drinks black iced tea, and I do mean only - I really have no use for any other beverages except occasionally wine. However, I just tastes the best drink I have ever had. A Chocolate Strawberry Bubble Tea. Sounds gross right. Yet, it waste more flavorful than any milkshake I have ever had without the heaviness. Sorry Shake Shack.  The tea tastes just like a chocolate covered strawberries and had these bubbles that exploded  and were the taste and consistency of fresh strawberries. The offerings are innumerable cannot wait to try more.

data.title: Even better after the remodel!
data.text: The drinks here have always been good, but they recently expanded their space and it looks great! More space to sit down or wait on your to-go order and more space for the baristas to help expedite service. They are also allergy friendly and offer dairy alternatives for their milk based drinks.

data.title: Tea Nirvana
data.text: My daughter suggested we vusit today...so we did. We beat the rush. The line is huge now. With cafe dining on 2nd floor and twa time drinks and desert seating on the first along with a shop, this place keeps everyone happy. The impressive large bubble tea, cold and hot tea selections and macaroon and tea cake selections are also tasty.  Put this on your to do list when stopping at Maritta Square!

data.title: Great Little Tea Bar
data.text: So bubble tea is growing in popularity and this place has some really unique creations. What's nice here is that their teas are fresh brewed and their flavors come from the tea and not just syrups.  So you will get a quality beverage. I have tried several combinations and each time I am VERY pleased. It's not the most budget friendly place to go, a glass of tea for $5+ but most bubble tea shops are going to be in the same range so you are paying for the unique drink, it's more of a treat for me and my daughter. Not to mention parking in the square is never anything I look forward to. So I definitly recommend Tiny Bubbles if you want to have the Bubble Tea experience and then you can decide if you love it enough as a regular staple or the occasional fun afternoon treat. EITHER WAY you are going to love their cute shop, the gift shop next door, the friendly staff and delicious teas!

data.title: Delicious Tea
data.text: The tea is delicious although very sweet. However i heard that you can ask for it prepared differently so that it is less sweet if you would like

data.title: Awesome vibe!
data.text: With the new renovations Tiny Bubbles has a great new vibe! We hung around for an hour and it always had a line of 15-20 people, although service was so awesome that they get you through quickly. Tea is unique and tasty! Love this place, will frequent often!

data.title: Excellent hot/cold tea selections with bubbles/boba balls
data.text: We tried several milk tea boba shops around Buford/Atlanta and found Tiny Bubbles to be the best of all.  The wide tea selections are excellent to choose from.  The bubbles/boba will explode with flavor in your mouth and its so refreshing.  My wife likes the milk tea but I like the clear tea selections.

data.title: Unique Tea
data.text: A friend brought me here and I absolutely loved it! The tea was phenomenal and the shop in the tea room was so much fun!! What a fun place for some girl time!! Can't wait to go back.

data.title: Closed for renovations :(
data.text: Wife and I were in town and looking for somewhere with Boba and found two places.  The first was Boba Bubbles and Tiny Bubbles.  We read the reviews and decided on Tiny Bubbles.  Parking is a nightmare for Tiny Bubbles but can be found.  Once we parked, walked over to the location.  Skipped Boba Bubbles for this place, closed for renovations...go figure.

data.title: My all-time favorite bubble tea spot
data.text: Tiny Bubbles bubble tea is some of the best I've ever had. I am a big fan of bubble tea and prefer this shop over all of the other options. Located on the Marietta Square with outdoor seating available, Tiny Bubbles is a great place to share an amazing drink with friends. The menu has flavors that appeal to both frequent and new bubble tea drinkers alike. Love this place!

data.title: Long, long line...not worth the wait
data.text: My close friend convinced me that we should go here since she enjoyed their tea. The line was LONG - order taking was SLOW. The place was crowded and hot, but I thought "this must be so good, it's worth the wait" - NOT! They gave me tea's that were iced, not warm like I had requested. Drinking those little squishy gross blobs at the bottom of my drink was disgusting. The Earl Grey Lavender I was looking forward to was not good tasting.

data.title: Thrilled to have bubble tea in Marietta!!
data.text: My daughter and I have been trekking to the Duluth/Buford Highway areas of town for our bubble tea fix so we're thrilled that there's now a bubble tea place on the Marietta Square close to our house!  Great bubble tea and macarons and VERY friendly service although it can get super crowded so be prepared for a line. Lots of different tea flavors too that I hadn't tried before.  Well worth a stop if you are a bubble tea fan like we are.

data.title: I got coffee, but my friend really liked the place.
data.text:
So yeah, this is gonna be one of those reviews where I go to the Mexican place and order a hamburger, right? Well, I'm not really keen on "popping things" in my drinks, but my friend was keen on it, so we stopped by so she could order.

I dunno, ever since I had that nice banana pudding when I was 9 and suddenly I felt finger-nail like objects in the bottom of the bowl (turned out to be coconut shavings -- yeah, that get image out of your head), I have this severe aversion to liquid meals having things in the bottom that burst or crunch or bleh.

So she ordered some kind of chocolate bubble tea and really liked the experience. I just ordered some coffee and it was ... you know, coffee-ish. The service, though, was incredibly friendly and we sat outside to enjoy the nice evening on the Marietta square.

data.title: Love them bubbles
data.text: I love the bubble teas.  They are so fun and delicious.  This is a small location in the heart of Marietta Square but it's always packed.

data.title: Interesting bar, I like the hot teas, but not the bubbles.
data.text: GF and I visited this coffee/tea house and was looking forward to trying this bubble concept. We personally didn't like the texture of it, but I really enjoyed sampling the hot tea of which you could buy bigger bags in the connecting store to make at home of loose leaf variety. Kinda small, so dont go if its too packed, just not enough room. When it's slower, its a great place to sit down and relax for a moment. Seating facing windows so you can even people watch. The connecting store is worth visiting and a sandwich shop upstairs.

data.title: Loved it!
data.text: I love bubble tea!  This is a cute little place connected to a cute little shop.  You get too choose your tea flavor and chewy and or popping bubbles.  So many choices... I will be back!

data.title: Fun!
data.text: Popular local bubble tea "bar". They also serve other hot and cold drinks as well, but the bubble tea is the thing here. Huge menu of flavors, and the youngsters that work here are just delightful.

data.title: Didn't get a hang of the tea flavors
data.text: The shop's in nice location.  We go to the east side of the city to have boba tea and I can say the flavors seemed a bit off here.  We got the matcha and salted caramel boba tea and taste didn't quite pan out as we thought it would.  It's a little pricey too, 5 bucks a tea on average...
